Bibliographic Ghosts: Oxford, Bodleian Library Addit. A.11 (SC 28746), ff. 41v, 42: Hamer says ‘Top.oxon.c.72 - wrong reference.’ A simple transposition would produce SC 29746, Lat. th.d.1, which is mostly Latin sermons w/ English verse, a MS added by (S) as was this entry.
_description:
Sentences of the Four Philosophers on the degeneracy of the times in a Latin exemplum incorporated into the Speculum Christiani
(Sexta Tabula) — twelve rhyming phrases in four monorhyming stanzas

Lam78.Transcription:
Myth ys rythlyth ys nythSyth is flythOne ys twoffrende
                    ys fowele ys wolust hath leueThyf ys reuePrede hath a
                    sleuewyl ys redewyt is [blank space]God ys dede

                    prose.
